Only a hobbledehoy could amuse him- self in this way," he added in Russian but pro- nouncing the word with a French accent hav- ing noticed that Zherkov could still hear him. 
He waited a moment to see whether the cor- net would answer, but he turned and went out of the corridor. 
THE PAVLOGRAD HUSSARS were stationed two miles from Braunau. The squadron in which Nicholas Rostov served as a cadet was quartered in the German village of Salzeneck. The best quarters in the villa
